column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Use a Document Organiser
#Text=Document organisers are an excellent way of keeping your documents organised .
#Text=They can help you keep all your important documents organised , but only if you use the organisers effectively .
#Text=So here are some simple steps for using yours well .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Purchase a document organiser .
#Text=The size will be determined by the documentation that you intend to keep .

#Text=If you only wish to store receipts , you may choose a smaller document organizer rather than if you are going to store larger pieces of paper and documents then you should probably choose a large document organiser .
#Text=Decide what categories you want to include .
#Text=Once you have decided on your categories , then you will need to label the tabs on the separate compartments .

#Text=It is usually best to alphabetize the separate compartments because later on when you are looking for a particular document , you will know what category it is under due to the nature of the document and will be able to either retrieve the document or file a new document because your separate compartments are already alphabetized , thus making it easier to locate .
#Text=Choose categories for your document organiser .
#Text=Some examples could include :
#Text=Agreements
#Text=Bank account(s) , Loan record(s) and Safe Deposit Instructions
#Text=Birth , baptismal and death records
#Text=Credit card company documents
#Text=Divorce , marriage , and separation documents
#Text=Financial : Bonds , home ownership paperwork , investments , tax documentation , land Deeds , mortgage paperwork , out of State home ownership paperwork , stocks , treasury bills , etc.
#Text=Important correspondences and documents
#Text=Insurance Records : Life , disability , medical , property and vehicle
#Text=Legal : Cemetery and funeral arrangements , health care proxy documents , last will and testament ( include attorney name with will instructions ) , and living wills
#Text=Miscellaneous
#Text=Retirement and superannuation documents
#Text=Tax records ( 7 years in many jurisdictions )
#Text=Travel : Passport and Visa documents
#Text=Vehicle ownership : Auto insurance documents , DMV documents ( title , and/or transfer paperwork ) , and gasoline ( petrol)/mileage ( kilometerage ) documents .
#Text=Keep your organisers up-to-date and in order .
#Text=Once you receive a new document , try to file as soon as possible .

#Text=Also if a document is needed that is currently in the document organiser , retrieve document , take necessary steps of why document was retrieved and after steps are completed , put retrieved document back in the document organizer under correct category originally retrieved from .
#Text=This takes only minutes and your organiser stays organised .
#Text=Consider a separate organizer for receipts .
#Text=If you need to keep receipts it may be a good idea to have a separate " Receipts Organiser " .

column1: #Text=The Receipts Organiser can be a cross-reference to your document organiser whereas you can insert in the relevant category a photocopy sheet which could include a brief description written on it .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you find that a document organiser just is not big enough for all your documents , then you can still use the breakdown above for a filing cabinet system .
#Text=Another option is to have a range of document organisers - one for each category that is needed .
#Text=These separate organizers could then be individually inserted into a filing cabinet in either alphabetical or most-used order .
#Text=Things
#Text=You 'll Need
#Text=Document organiser(s) of size(s) required .
